University of La Verne Office of Institutional Research

strategic_profile.executive_summary: Founded in 1891, the University of La Verne is a private, nonprofit institution in Southern California recognized as a federally designated Hispanic-Serving Institution (HSI). It emphasizes a liberal arts foundation integrated with professional preparation, ethical reasoning, and community engagement across its primary colleges.

analyst_takeaways.insight: The acceptance rate dropped from approximately 76% in 2020 to 48.5% in recent competitive cycles, though it remains volatile year-over-year.
analyst_takeaways.implication: Applicants should utilize Early Action pathways to navigate increasing selectivity and secure institutional aid.

analyst_takeaways.insight: Strong focus on STEM equity evidenced by Howard Hughes Medical Institute (HHMI) and Keck Foundation grants.
analyst_takeaways.implication: High-value opportunities exist for first-generation and underrepresented students in research immersion programs (CUREs).

campus_dynamics.social_environment: Life is centered around the Abraham Campus Center and 'Sneaky Park,' with a strong emphasis on multicultural clubs and student-led programming through the Campus Activities Board (CAB). The social scene is largely influenced by its NCAA Division III 'Leopard' athletics and Greek life.
campus_dynamics.transportation_impact: A high commuter population (approx. 65%) creates a 'suitcase campus' dynamic on weekends; the university utilizes a real-time shuttle app and integrated mobile platform to bridge the gap for students traveling from the wider Los Angeles/Inland Empire area.
campus_dynamics.research_impact: Research is driven by the La Verne Academy, focusing on faculty-student collaboration in fields like AI (bolstered by a $1M Fletcher Jones Foundation grant) and wildfire detection technology at the Neher Montana Field Research Station.

longitudinal_trends.notes: A significant surge in applications occurred this cycle, resulting in a notably lower acceptance rate compared to previous years.

gpa.notes: University typically admits students with a 'B' average; roughly 34% of admitted students have a GPA of 3.75 or higher.

testing.policy_note: Test-optional for most programs; scores are considered if submitted.

women.note: Women represent ~63% of the total applicant pool.

colleges.name: College of Arts and Sciences
colleges.strategic_fit_advice: Ideal for students seeking a values-based liberal arts education with faculty mentorship.
colleges.housing_profile: Traditional living in Citrus Hall (freshmen) or 'The Oaks'.
colleges.student_archetype: Intellectually curious and socially conscious learners.

majors.name: Biology
majors.special_requirements: Requires completion of two CURE classes.
majors.notes: Maintains the Neher Montana Research Station.

colleges.name: College of Business and Public Management
colleges.strategic_fit_advice: Strong for career-driven students looking for networking in Greater LA.
colleges.housing_profile: Suite-style living in Vista La Verne preferred by upperclassmen.
colleges.student_archetype: Ambitious future leaders and networking-focused professionals.

majors.name: Business Administration
majors.special_requirements: Grade of C or better in all prerequisite courses.
majors.notes: Most popular major; offers 4+1 MBA/MSDA options.

supplemental_requirements.details: Minimum 250 words answering Common App or internal prompts.

holistic_factors.specific_differentiators: As an HSI, values community engagement and first-gen success.

major_selection_tactics: Apply as 'Undeclared' to maximize admission odds (~20% enter this way)
Apply to 4+1 programs early to secure a faster track to a Master's
college_ranking_tactics: Rank the College of Business higher for data analytics tracks
Prioritize LaFetra College of Education for evening cohort options
application_strategy.alternate_major_strategy: List 'Undeclared' or a related Humanities major as an alternate if targeting competitive STEM fields.

scholarships.name: Performance Scholarship
scholarships.benefits: Available in Art, Music, Theatre, and Communications

ap_policy.general_rule: Score of 3+ grants credit (up to 44 hours).
exceptions: AP Music Theory used for placement only
ap_policy.usage: Applies toward LVGE, major prerequisites, or electives.

ib_policy.general_rule: Score of 4+ grants credit (~4 units per exam).

transfer_articulation.restrictions: Max 88 semester hours; minimum grade of C- required.

what_it_takes: Competitive GPA (3.0+) with consistent core subject performance
Alignment with community service and civic engagement values
essay_tips: Be highly reflective: explain the 'why' behind experiences
Showcase commitment to diversity and small-campus community contribution
red_flags: Noticeable grade decline in senior year
Generic essays lacking personal connection to campus
insights: Niche Direct Admissions partnership accepts students based on Niche profiles
Test-optional strategy still uses scores for honors program benchmarks
